Key Match Events: The OKC Thunder dominated the first half against the Memphis Grizzlies on Sunday before coasting to a 130-106 win.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander set the tone for Oklahoma with 23 points in the first two quarters.
Jalen Williams added 14 points, 10 rebounds, eight assists and two steals.
The Thunder put on a clinic on defense in the second quarter, limiting the Grizzlies to 19 points.
Post-Match Reflections: Oklahoma improved its record to 26-5, while Memphis dropped to 22-11.
Luke Kennard and Jay Huff desperately tried to rally the Grizzlies in the fourth quarter but didn't have enough to turn the game around.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder's bench led by rookie Ajay Mitchell contributed significantly to the team's effort.
Oklahoma's bench closed out the quarter for a 130-106 win.
Others: Without Ja Morant, Desmond Bane carried the Grizzlies with 22 points, nine rebounds and four assists.
John Konchar, taking over the inactive Zach Edey, contributed four points, 15 rebounds, three steals and two blocks.
